metadata.Title: CVE-2020-11985 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: IP address spoofing when proxying using mod_remoteip and mod_rewrite For configurations using proxying with mod_remoteip and certain mod_rewrite rules, an attacker could spoof their IP address for logging and PHP scripts. Note this issue was fixed in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.24 but was retrospectively allocated a low severity CVE in 2020.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> released pre-CVE assignment as an SRU to xenial

criterions.comment: apache2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
